title: Bike Tour San Isidro, Miraflores and Barranco,
description: Explore Lima's vibrant neighborhoods by bike on this half-day cycle tour. Visit the colorful Barranco district, Miraflores Boardwalk, and San Isidro neighborhood. marvel at the architecture and learn about the history and culture of each area from your knowledgeable guide. Traveling on two wheels is a great way to see the best of Lima in a short amount of time.
all_descriptions: Explore Lima's vibrant neighborhoods by bike on this half-day cycle tour. Visit the colorful Barranco district, Miraflores Boardwalk, and San Isidro neighborhood. marvel at the architecture and learn about the history and culture of each area from your knowledgeable guide. Traveling on two wheels is a great way to see the best of Lima in a short amount of time.

ItineraryThis is a typical itinerary for this productStop At:Bridge of Sighs, Jr. Batallon, Ayacucho 271, Lima 15063 PeruWe will visit the colourful and bohemian Barranco's neighbourhood and it's nice plazas, beautiful parks and historical ranchos and mansions.Duration: 15 minutesStop At:Miraflores Boardwalk, Malecon de la Reserva 275, Lima 15074 PeruOne of the greatest experiences that people can enjoy it's the bike ride through the Miraflores Malecon.Duration: 20 minutesStop At:San Isidro, Lima 15073 PeruOne of the most beautiful neighbourhoods from Lima and sadly underrated. We will make you love it as we do!Duration: 40 minutes
Lirios, San Isidro 15046, PeruLos Lirios Street 148 San Isidro.
End:This activity ends back at the meeting point.

Lucia Lopez
Lima, Peru9 contributions

Excellent experience with Maverick

Fantastic tour with our guide Maverick by ravine and Miraflores. It is very worth the experience, we enjoyed very nice views and places guided by an excellent explanation from our guide Maverick. At all times he was a caring and friendly guide. We laughed a lot and enjoyed the group a lot. I recommend this tour.

Colin B
1 contribution

Fun way to get to know parts of Lima

Apr 2025 • Couples
This was a super fun way to cover more ground in the city, especially if it’s your first day in Lima. We really enjoyed our tour guide - he was a real character and gave us some great local recommendations. The best part was getting to bike around the City, which has some robust bike infrastructure and lovely green spaces. You can cover a lot of ground on the bikes. Biking on the roads without bike lanes could be hairy because of the traffic rules, so I recommend this only if you are a comfortable urban biker. Overall a fun non traditional tour of Lima!
Written April 11, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Lida v
1 contribution

Not great

Jan 2025 • Friends
The tour guide was nice but the tour was pretty bad. We all had different types of bikes that lacked quality. The route seemed random, sending us on and off the sidewalk with our bikes and cycling in parks where we were not supposed to. The locals were telling us and the police even asked is to step off our bikes. Tour guide crossed red lights and just left us to follow him. Didn’t get much information. Basically just stretching time riding circles in the city.
Written January 19, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Matt
Charlotte, NC17 contributions

Amazing bike ride through a beautiful city with a great guide.

Franco was amazing, his knowledge of the different districts is vast, and his English is very good. He took my wife and I to many different parks and neighborhoods, teaching us the history along the way. Before the bike ride he got us both a water and along the bike ride we stopped for the restroom when needed. All together it was a relatively easy bike ride on flat land but Barranco has many hills. None that are too steep but you will definitely get tired in barranco.
Written December 31, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

millicent23
Boulder, CO15 contributions

Amazing bike tour

I was visiting Lima solo and joined Franco’s bike tour 2 days in a row! It’s an adventure cycling in Lima and he knows all if the best ways to get around and through the traffic. He also knows so much about Peruvian history and Lima so it feels like a little classroom on wheels. I did both the city center tour and the more ocean side tour and they were both great. I love to see a new place by bicycle and I cannot give Franco a higher recommendation. Sign up if you are planning a trip to Lima.
Written December 5, 2024

Easy tour, fun!

Oct 2024 • Solo
Bike tour in Lima with guide Gonzalo. Guide really took the time to answer questions and knew a lot. We did a standard tour, about 18 kilometers in 3 hours. Not difficult at all, we took the time for a coffee along the way. Very good experience! Would totally recommend it :-)

Perfect Tour! Great experience.

Oct 2024 • Couples
Interesting tour of Lima's most characteristic neighbourhoods. Our guide Joao was perfect and provided us with lots of interesting information and valuable local tips. The best way to see these beautiful neighbourhoods if you are short on time.
I must also say that BToL was very patient with our delay due to traffic and still managed to give us the full experience.
Written October 21, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Ellen
9 contributions

Great way to see more of Lima than walking. Wish there was a better helmet though

Oct 2024 • Couples
Gonzalo was a friendly guide and showed us a number of great viewpoints throughout the San Isidro, Miraflores, and Barranco districts. He helped us navigate safely in the chaotic traffic when there are no bike lanes.

I’d say this bike tour is only suitable for those comfortable riding on tight roads with cars and pedestrians as well as potholes and bumps. I would have wanted a better helmet — the one I got didn’t have much front protection so I felt if an accident should happen, I’d likely still hit my forehead. The helmet’s padding was missing too so the velcro kept tearing at my hair during the ride so that was uncomfortable too.
Written October 19, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
GWDOGS
Austin, TX28 contributions

Great tour, great guide

Franco was a great guide. He arranged to have us picked up at our hotel in Barranco and provided water and helmets and dropped us off at the end back at our hotel. We even arranged a ceviche stop in Miraflores. He stopped whenever we requested for pictures as well as provided a lot of historical insights. Can’t recommend him highly enough
Written September 23, 2024

reviews.title: Excellent experience with Maverick
reviews.text: Fantastic tour with our guide Maverick by ravine and Miraflores. It is very worth the experience, we enjoyed very nice views and places guided by an excellent explanation from our guide Maverick. At all times he was a caring and friendly guide. We laughed a lot and enjoyed the group a lot. I recommend this tour.

reviews.title: Fun way to get to know parts of Lima
reviews.text: This was a super fun way to cover more ground in the city, especially if it’s your first day in Lima. We really enjoyed our tour guide - he was a real character and gave us some great local recommendations. The best part was getting to bike around the City, which has some robust bike infrastructure and lovely green spaces. You can cover a lot of ground on the bikes. Biking on the roads without bike lanes could be hairy because of the traffic rules, so I recommend this only if you are a comfortable urban biker. Overall a fun non traditional tour of Lima!

reviews.text: The tour guide was nice but the tour was pretty bad. We all had different types of bikes that lacked quality.  The route seemed random, sending us on and off the sidewalk with our bikes and cycling in parks where we were not supposed to. The locals were telling us and the police even asked is to step off our bikes. Tour guide crossed red lights and just left us to follow him. Didn’t get much information. Basically just stretching time riding circles in the city.

Before the bike ride he got us both a water and along the bike ride we stopped for the restroom when needed. All together it was a relatively easy bike ride on flat land but Barranco has many hills. None that are too steep but you will definitely get tired in barranco.

He also knows so much about Peruvian history and Lima so it feels like a little classroom on wheels. I did both the city center tour and the more ocean side tour and they were both great. We even arranged a ceviche stop in Miraflores. He stopped whenever we requested for pictures as well as provided a lot of historical insights.  Can’t recommend him highly enough
